intro: Matelea liesneri, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a heart-shaped appearance, while its stems are often hairy. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hard seeds.
